intro: Lepidagathis pallescens subsp. obtusata, commonly known as the broad-leaved lepidagathis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and ovate, leathery leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. This species is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and rocky areas.
